import os
import pytest
import signal
from contextlib import contextmanager
from time import time
from unittest.mock import patch
from unittest.mock import Mock
from unittest.mock import call

class test_reset_signals():
    @contextmanager
    def assert_context(self):
        with termsigs(default, full):
            with patch('signal.getsignal') as GET:
                with patch('signal.signal') as SET:
                    GET.return_value = get_returns
                    SET.side_effect = set_effect
                    reset_signals()
                    GET.assert_has_calls([call(signo(sig)) for sig in default])
                    yield GET, SET
    
test_reset_signals().assert_context()

import os
import pytest
import signal
from contextlib import contextmanager
from time import time
from unittest.mock import patch
from unittest.mock import Mock
from unittest.mock import call

@contextmanager
def termsigs(default, full):
    original_default = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGINT)
    original_full = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGQUIT)
    
    signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, default_handler)
    signal.signal(signal.SIGQUIT, full_handler)
    
    try:
        yield
    finally:
        signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, original_default)
        signal.signal(signal.SIGQUIT, original_full)

def default_handler(signum, frame):
    pass

def full_handler(signum, frame):
    pass
